title: Characteristics of Effective Teams
content: High-performing teams share characteristics: clear purpose, defined roles, open communication, mutual trust, constructive conflict resolution, and shared accountability. These aren't personality traits—they're practices that can be developed.

scenario.story: Two teams handle similar operations. Team A has skilled individuals who compete for recognition and rarely share information unless required. Team B has mixed experience levels but members actively support each other and share learnings. During a complex situation, Team A's members each solve their piece but miss an interaction between components. Team B catches the interaction through their information sharing.

options.A: Team A needs more skilled members
options.B: Team B's collaborative practices produced better outcomes than Team A's individual skill

scenario.explanation: Individual competence without coordination leaves gaps. Team B's practices—sharing information, mutual support—created collective capability greater than the sum of parts. Team performance isn't just aggregated individual performance.
